section.title: Introduction
section.para: This document describes how to install, configure and calibrate TIANI's DICOM Print Server jPrint 1.2 for proper mode of operation.
jPrint 1.2 is delivered pre-configured, to enable to run with minimal adaptions of the default configuration according your printing environment.

To achieve hard copy presentation quality and consistency compliant to DICOM Part 14: Grayscale Standard Display Function, jPrint 1.2 has to quantify the characteristic curve of connected printers. This procedure is called Printer Calibration, and shall be repeated in regular intervalls, but particular after any printer adjustment (e.g. toner refill).

jPrint 1.2 also supports configuration of modality specific Presentation LUTs, for the - still common - case, that the Print Composer implementation of the modality (or workstation) does not provide an appropriate Presentation LUT by itself.
Also different annotation formats can be configured and associated to Print Jobs from a particular Print SCU.

section.title: Requirements

listitem.para: Sun Java[tm] 2 runtime 1.4.0_01 or above. J2SE SDK recommended: required for use of "server" VM and for running jPrint with embedded Audit Record Repository (jAudit 0.1).
At least 128Mb of memory and a 400MHz CPU.

100Mb free disk space - mainly for spooled print jobs (jPrint 1.2 program files allocate less than 10Mb); if the performance of the connected printer is not sufficient to forward incoming print jobs just-in-time, much more (>1 Gb) disk space may be required, to enable jPrint to buffer print jobs as long the connected printer is not ready to accept them.
Network card.

Reference sheet with test pattern required for Printer Calibration using scanned print outs. - You will receive an exemplar by paper post when you order the (evaluation) license of jPrint at http://www.tiani.com/products/jprint/.
Scanner to scan reference sheet and printed test patterns for Printer Calibration.
Gray Scale Densitometer as alternative to the Printer Calibration using a scanner and for quantitative QA of Printer Calibration.

section.para: jPrint has been tested with Sun Java 2 SDK SE 1.4.1_01 under Windows XP and GNU/Linux Debian Woody 2.4.18-686.

listitem.para: Before installing and running the server, you should check that your JDK 1.4.x installation is working. The simplest way to do this is to execute the java -version command to ensure that the java executable is in your path, and that you are using version 1.4:
listitem.programlisting: $ java -version java version "1.4.1_01" Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1_01-b01) Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.1_01-b01, mixed mode)
listitem.para: You should also ensure, that the environment variable JAVA_HOME is set to the path of the JDK installation directory. E.g. on UNIX systems by
, on Windows systems by
Download the latest version of jPrint from http://www.tiani.com/products/jprint/.
jPrint is distributed in two different formats:
Contains jPrint DICOM print server + utilities, bundled with a down stripped JBoss application server distribution (s. http://www.jboss.org) , to run out of the box.
Additionally contains jAudit as Audit Record Repository to store audit records generated by jPrint in a - also included - database for audit purposes.
Unpack the jPrint distribution somewhere, using any ZIP decompressor or the jar tool included in the Java 2 SDK:
Copy your license file license.jks into the server/default/conf/ directory of the distribution.

note.para: You may order a free evaluation license for jPrint 1.2 using the form at http://www.tiani.com/products/jprint/ .

listitem.para: Open a console and change your working directory to the bin/ directory of the distribution:
Check if your license is valid for running jPrint 1.2 on this host by utility check-license.jar:
listitem.programlisting:
$ java -jar check-license.jar ../server/default/conf/license.jks
=== License #1 ===
Subject: CN=Gunter Zeilinger, OU=Development, O=Tiani Medgraph AG, L=Brunn am Gebirge, ST=Lower Austria, C=AT Issuer: CN=Tiani License CA, OU=Development, O=Tiani Medgraph AG, L=Brunn am Gebirge, ST=Lower Austria, C=AT Validity ok Not Before: Sat Apr 12 23:55:42 CEST 2003 Not After: Fri Apr 07 23:55:42 CEST 2023 Host Identification: IP: 212.186.124.39 match MAC: 00:50:04:3F:83:0F match DNS: gunter.tiani.org match Product(s): 1.2.40.0.13.2.1.1.2/jPrint-1.2 1.2.40.0.13.2.2.0.1/jAudit-0.1

listitem.para: Determine printer names of installed system and network printers by utility list-printers.jar:
listitem.programlisting: $ java -jar list-printers.jar Available Printers: MINOLTA psc750gimp psc750hpijs

listitem.para: Open the configuration file server/default/deploy/printer-service.xml with any text editor, which treats ASCII files with a single linefeed as line delimiter (UNIX style) properly. NotePad on Microsoft Windows fails to do that, but you may use WordPad, which displays UNIX line formated text files correctly. Replace myprinter.
listitem.programlisting: <!-- Specifies name of the printer used by the system. --> <attribute name="PrinterName">myprinter</attribute>
listitem.para: by the actual name of the connected printer tu use - must be one of Available Printers listed above.
[optional] If you want to change the default Application Entity Title (AET), associated with the printer, you have also to replace TIANI_PRINT in the same configuration file some lines above.

[optional] If you want to change the default port (6104), where the DICOM server shall be listening for incoming association requests from Print Clients, you have also to replace 6104 in the server configuration file server/default/deploy/printer-service.xml:
listitem.programlisting: <!-- Specifies TCP port on which the DICOM server is listening. --> <attribute name="Port">6104</attribute>
listitem.para: by the TCP port number to use.
On UNIX you have to change the permission of the server launch script:
before you can start the server by:
listitem.programlisting:
$ ./run.sh ================================================================================
JBoss Bootstrap Environment
JBOSS_HOME: /usr/local/jprint-1.2.1
JAVA: /usr/local/java/j2sdk1.4.1_01/bin/java
JAVA_OPTS: -Xms64m -Xmx100m -server -Dprogram.name=run.sh
CLASSPATH: /usr/local/jprint-1.2.1/bin/run.jar:/usr/local/j2sdk1.4.1_01/lib/tools.jar
================================================================================
15:32:26,548 INFO [Server] JBoss Release: JBoss-3.0.7 CVSTag=JBoss_3_0_7 : 15:32:41,590 INFO [Server] JBoss (MX MicroKernel) [3.0.7 (CVSTag=JBoss_3_0_7 Date=200304081816)] Started in 0m:14s:950ms
listitem.para: On WINDOWS you can start the server by enter
If the license file you copied in step 4 into the server/default/conf/ directory works, you will find the confirmation
in the console output - otherwise the warning:
listitem.programlisting: 15:32:41,383 WARN [PrintScpService] No valid Licensedetected - shutdown server in 20 minutes!
listitem.para: You will get (2) warnings:
because no preparation for Printer Calibration was done yet.
Open another console and change the working directory (again) to the bin/ directory of the jPrint distribution:
Initiate the print-out of the DSI256 pattern used to determine the characteristic curve of the printer by utility print-image.jar:
For color printers, also print the DSI256 pattern in color mode:
Scan the (2) print-out(s) and the reference sheet with equal scanning parameters and store
the scanned reference sheet as JPEG file DSI256.jpg into the server/default/conf/calibration directory,
the scanned DSI256 pattern print-out in monochrome mode (no -c option) into the TIANI_PRINT.monochrome sub-directory - the only constraint for the chosen file name is to end with ".jpg",
and - only for color printer - the scanned DSI256 pattern print-out in color mode (with -c option) into the TIANI_PRINT.color sub-directory - again using a file name which ends with ".jpg".
Initiate the calibrated print-out of the WEDGE8 pattern by:
and check the qualitity of the calibration visibly: The hardcopy should not contain visible contours - the transition from dark to bright within the wedge should be smooth.
You may also compare the result against the print-out of the same pattern without calibration by
For color printers, repeat the check for a calibrated print-out of the WEDGE8 pattern in color mode:

jPrint is now ready to accept DICOM associations on port 6104 - or the port configured in step 10. The Called AET associated with the connected printer is TIANI_PRINT - or the AET configured in step 9. Any Calling AET will be accepted at default configuration.

section.title: jPrint as Unix/Windows Startup Service
section.para: It is recommended, to test printing with a jPrint instance started manually from a console window as described above, so you can monitor proper function (or malfunction) by the logging output to the console window instantaneously , before running jPrint as Unix/Windows Startup Service. Then you have to look into the always generated log file server/default/log/server.log, to see what is going on/wrong.

section.title: Install jPrint as Unix Service
section.para: You have to be super user to install a Unix Startup Service on the system.

listitem.para: Open bin/jprint_init_debian.sh in any ASCII editor and adjust the values of run-time parameters:
Location of JAVA 2 SDK installation directory.
Location of jPrint installation directory.
specify user, under which jPrint will run on the system. (Must have write permission to jprint installation subdirectory server/default/tmp).
Save the modified script to /etc/init.d/jprint and make it executable by the super-user:
Test your installation by calling the startup script in /etc/init.d:
and evaluate successful startup by inspection of server log file server/default/log/server.log.
Stop the server by
Create symbolic links S90jprint to /etc/init.d/jprint in /etc/rc.2, /etc/rc.2, /etc/rc.3 to start jPrint when changing to multi-user runtime-level:
Create symbolic links K10jprint to /etc/init.d/jprint in /etc/rc.0, /etc/rc.1, /etc/rc.6 to stop jPrint when leaving multi-user runtime-level:

section.title: Install jPrint as Windows NT / W2K Service

listitem.para: Open a console and change your working directory to the bin/ directory of the distribution:
Invoke install_service with server as parameter, to install the Windows Service using the Java HotSpot Server VM to run jprint:
Or invoke install_service with client as parameter, to install the Windows Service using the Java HotSpot Client VM to run jprint:

Using the server option is recommended (s.a. http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.1/docs/guide/vm/index.html). But if only Java 2 Runtime is installed you have to use the client option, because the Java HotSpot Server VM is only included in the Java 2 SDK distribution.

[optional] Open the Windows Service Manager and verify, that the service was registered with the name jprint-1.2.x. It will be started automatically with next system reboot. You may start it immediately by the Windows Service Manager.

section.title: Uninstall the Windows NT / W2K Service
section.para: To uninstall the service again you may invoke install_service with uninstall as parameter:
If the service was running, it will not be removed immediately by this command, but will be removed with next system reboot.
To stop and remove the service immediately, you have to use the Windows Service Manger instead.

section.title: Content of the jPrint installation directory
section.para: The structure of the jPrint installation directory is shaped by the included JBoss application server distribution (s. http://www.jboss.org):
section.programlisting: jprint-1.2.x/ + bin/ + client/ + doc/ + images/ + lib/ + server/ + default/ + conf/ + annotation/ + calibration/ + lut/ + deploy/ + lib/ + log/ + tmp/
section.para: The subdirectories log/ and tmp/ of directory jprint-1.2.x/server/default/ are not part of the jPrint distribution package, but are created at first server startup.
jprint-with-jaudit-1.2.x.zip contains additional subdirectories which are describted at .
Subdirectory bin/ contains executable jars of jPrint utilities and various shell scripts to start the server manually or automatically during system boot:

listitem.para: Executable jar of utility check-license.jar, to check if your license is valid for running jPrint 1.2 on this host.
Executable jar of utility list-printers.jar, to determine printer names of installed system and network printers.
Executable jar of utility print-image.jar, to print a DICOM image - particularlly, one of the test pattern in subdirectory images/ used for Printer Calibration..
Executable jar of utility view-plut.jar, to visualize the effect of applying various Presentation LUTs on a particular DICOM image.
Executable jar of utility view-printerODs.jar, to evaluate printer characteristic from scanned print-outs.
Entry point jar of JBoss application server.
Bash shell script to start the server on UNIX platforms.
Windows batch file to start the server on WIndows platforms.
Windows batch file to install/uninstall the server as Windows NT / W2K.
Windows executable required to run the server as Windows NT / W2K Service.
Server startup/shutdown script for Debian GNU/Linux systems.
Server startup/shutdown script for RedHat Linux systems.

section.para: Subdirectory client/ contains jars required for jPrint utilities (i.e.: bin/print-image.jar), to access JBoss services via the JMX/RMI adapter.
Subdirectory doc/ contains jPrint documention files:

listitem.para: jPrint Service Manual (this document).
jPrint DICOM Conformance Statement.

Hardcopy Calibration Form (MS Excel spreadsheet) for qualitative verification of proper Printer Calibration [download from IHE Year 3 Display Consistency page: http://wuerlim.wustl.edu/mesa/software/consistency/index.html].
Open Office Verion of doc/gsdf_od.xls.

Consistency of Softcopy and Hardcopy: Preliminary Experiences with the new DICOM Extensions for Image Display by Marco Eichelberg et al., which describes the DICOM concepts Grayscale Standard Display Function, Grayscale Softcopy Presentation State and Presentation Look Up Table, and why its implementation by workstations, print composers and print servers improves the consistency between displayed and printed images. [download from IHE Year 3 Display Consistency page: http://wuerlim.wustl.edu/mesa/software/consistency/index.html].

section.para: Subdirectory images/ contains DICOM files with test patterns:

listitem.para: Philips dsitest image used for quatitative verification of proper Printer Calibration.
Modified Philips dsitest image with 256 different shades of gray used for Printer Calibration.
8-bit Wedge pattern with 256 different shades of gray for qualitative verification of the print quality.
12-bit wedge pattern with 4096 different shades of gray for qualitative verification of the print quality.
Pixel Aspect Ratio pattern to test support of Pixel Aspect Ratio by the Print Server.

section.para: Subdirectory lib/ contains startup jars used by JBoss.
Subdirectory server/default/lib/ contains further jars required by JBoss internal services and deployed jPrint services.
Subdirectory server/default/deploy/ contains configuration files of deployed jPrint services:

listitem.para: Configures the Audit Logger Service, which controls the transmission of Audit Records generated by jPrint.
Configures the generic DICOM Server Service.
Configures the Print SCP Service, which spools received DICOM Print Requests to disk and schedule their processing by the Printer Service.
Configures the Printer Service, which transforms spooled DICOM Print Requests to Print Jobs for a connected (system or network) printer.

section.para: Subdirectory server/default/conf/ contains all remaining configuration files:

listitem.para: Defines JBoss core service configuration. You should not need to alter this configuration.
Defines JNDI Context used by JBoss internally. You should not need to alter this configuration.
Configures the Apache log4j framework category priorities and appenders used by JBoss and deployed jPrint Service. Edit this file, if you want to change the default logging behavior.

Your license to run jPrint-1.2. It is not included in jprint-1.2.x.zip! You receive it separately by e-mail and have to copy it into server/default/conf/ yourself. license.jks is also usable as server certificate, if operating the server in secure mode (DICOM-TLS).
Contains certificates of trusted certification authorities. Only used in secure mode (DICOM-TLS).

section.para: Subdirectory server/default/conf/annotation contains configuration files specifing Annotation Display Formats provided by jPrint:

listitem.para: Specifies Annotation Display Format TITLE: 5 Annotation Boxes located on the four edges and one - with larger font size - centered at the top of the page. Used for all DICOM prints with default server/default/deploy/printer-service.xml. Usually you will at least edit the specified Default Title.

Specifies Annotation Display Format NO_TITLE: Like Annotation Display Format TITLE, but without a centered Annotation Box at the top of the page. Used for print-outs initiated with utility print-image.jar at default configuration.

section.para: Subdirectory server/default/conf/calibration contains configuration files related to Printer Calibration:

listitem.para: Contains list of measured values of optical densities of gray steps in reference sheet with DSI256 pattern.

section.para: Subdirectory server/default/conf/lut contains DICOM files with local Presentation Lookup Tables provided by jPrint:

listitem.para: Presentation LUT defined and used by PHILIPS.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: Configuration of jPrint is based on simple (ASCII) text files, which can be modified by any text editor, which treats ASCII files with a single linefeed as line delimiter (UNIX style) properly. NotePad on Microsoft Windows fails to do that, but you may use WordPad, which displays UNIX line formated text files correctly.

section.title: Deployed jPrint Services
section.para: Configuration files in subdirectory server/default/deploy/ are one-to-one related to instances of jPrint Services, which are deployed in the JBoss Application Server as so-called MBeans (managed beans), which provides - in co-operation with each-other - the functionality needed to receive DICOM print requests and process them to print jobs forwarded to the connected printer(s):

listitem.para: Configures the Audit Logger Service, which controls the transmission of Audit Records generated by jPrint. Edit this file to change the host (default: localhost) or port (default: 4000) of the syslog server, to which Audit Records shall be transmitted.
Configures the generic DICOM Server. Edit this file to change the server port (default: 6104) or to switch to secure mode (DICOM-TLS).

Configures the Print SCP Service, which spools received DICOM Print Requests to disk and schedule their processing by the Printer Service. Edit this file to change the default spool directory [server/deafult/tmp/spool] or to keep spooled Print Requests for debugging or for ajusting local Presentation LUTs to particular Print Requests.

Configures the Printer Service, which transforms spooled DICOM Print Requests to Print Jobs for a connected (system or network) printer. You have to edit this file to specify a vaild (=existing) printer name on your system. Also the Called AET [TIANI_PRINT], with which this printer must be addressed by the Print Composer, is specified here.

section.title: Audit Logger Service
section.para: The Audit Logger Service controls the transmission of Audit Records generated by jPrint.
Following attributes are defined by its configuration file server/default/deploy/auditlog-service.xml:

row.entry: Specifies hostname or IP of the Audit Record Repository, to which Audit Records shall be transmitted.
Specifies UDP port on which the Audit Record Repository is listening.
Specifies the value of the Facility element in the Syslog header of transmitted Audit Records. Possible values are: user, auth, authpriv, local0, local1, ... , local7
Set to false, to deactivate transmission of ActorStartStop Audit messages.
Set to false, to deactivate transmission of SecurityAlert Audit messages.
Set to false, to deactivate transmission of ActorConfig Audit messages.
Set to false, to deactivate transmission of Export Audit messages.

section.title: DICOM Server
section.para: General DICOM Server with support of secure (DICOM-TLS) mode. In secure mode SecurityAlert Audit Records will be generate and forwarded for transmisstion to the Audit Logger Service in the case of connection attempts by unauthorized clients.
Following attributes are defined by its configuration file server/default/deploy/dcmsrv-service.xml:

row.entry: Set maximal number of simultaneously conncected DICOM clients.

Specifies whether the server runs in TLS mode:dicom
native DICOM (without TLS).dicom-tls
DICOM over TLS; triple DES EDE CBC encryption is provided, but not forced by the server.dicom-tls.3des
DICOM over TLS with triple DES EDE CBC encryptiondicom-tls.nodes
DICOM over TLS without encryption
Specifies TCP port on which the DICOM server is listening.

entry.para: Specifies Called AETs, which the DICOM server shall accept. Multiple values can be specified, must be separated by '\' characters. Use the single value "any" to accept any Called AET in the A-ASSOCIATE RQ.

Whether DICOM Print Services are actual provided depends, if there is a Printer Service associated to the Called AET in the A-ASSOCIATE RQ configured. If not, only the DICOM Verification Service will be provided by the server.

row.entry: Specifies Calling AETs, which the DICOM server shall accept. Multiple values can be specified, must be separated by '\' characters. Use the single value "any" to accept any Called AET in the A-ASSOCIATE RQ.

Specifies Timeout in ms, the DICOM server will wait after accepting the TCP connect for the A-ASSOCIATE RQ. "0" means, there is no Timeout, so the server would wait as long the TCP connection will not be closed from the peer application.
Specifies Timeout in ms, the DICOM server will wait after the receive of DIMSE message on an established association. "0" means, there is no Timeout.
Specifies Timeout in ms, the DICOM server will wait after sending a A-RELEASE RSP or an A-ABORT RQ for DIMSE message on an established association. "0" means, there is no Timeout.
Specifies maximal PDU package length for receiving PDUs.

entry.para: Specifies if Command and Data PDVs can be packed in one PDU.
There are well-known bugs of some DICOM implementions in support of this performance improving DICOM feature.

row.entry: Defines file containing key used in SSL handshake, when running in TLS mode. Relative path names are resolved using jboss server directory as base directory.
Defines password for access to key file, specified by attribute KeyFile.
Defines file containing accepted certificates, when running in TLS mode Relative path names are resolved using jboss server directory as base directory.
Defines password for access to cacerts file, specified by attribute CacertsFile.

section.title: Print SCP Service
section.para: The Print SCP Service is registered at the DICOM server. It spools received DICOM Print Requests to disk and schedule their processing by the connected Printer Service, which is associated with the Called AET used by the Print Composer in the Association Request. It also generates of Audit Records for requested/performed Print Jobs and forward them to the Audit Logger Service for transmission.
Following attributes are defined by its configuration file server/default/deploy/prnscp-service.xml:

row.entry: Defines whether an Audit Record shall be generated for each successful created Film Session Instance. Only AuditCreateSession OR AuditCreateFilmBox OR AuditPrintJob shall be set to true.
Defines whether an Audit Record shall be generated for each successful created Film Box Instance. Only AuditCreateSession OR AuditCreateFilmBox OR AuditPrintJob shall be set to true.

Defines whether an Audit Record shall be generated for each scheduled Print Job. Generates usally one Audit Record for every printed page, because most Print SCUs request a separate Print Job for each page to print. Only AuditCreateSession OR AuditCreateFilmBox OR AuditPrintJob shall be set to true.
Defines file containing the license to run jPrint. Relative path names are resolved using jboss server directory as base directory.
Defines password for access to license file, specified by attribute LicenseFile. Required to specify, if license is stored in PKCS12 [.p12] keystore.
Specifies spool directory used for buffering print jobs, before they can be forwarded to the printer. Relative path names are resolved using jboss server directory as base directory.
Set to true, to keep spool files for debugging.
Set to true, to return success status in DIMSE RSP message instead of warning. Workaround for print clients, which abort the print request, if they receive a warning status.

section.title: Printer Service
section.para: The Printer Service transforms spooled DICOM Print Requests to Print Jobs for a connected (system or network) printer.

The Printer Service configuration also defines the Called AET, which have to be used by the Print Composer in the DICOM Association Request. It is possible to configure several Printer Services - with different Called AETs - to enable print outs on several different actual printers connected to the system.
At default, only one Printer Service, associated with Called AET TIANI_PRINT is configured by file server/default/deploy/printer-service.xml:
section.programlisting:
<!-- ===================================================================== --> <!-- --> <!-- Printer Service Configuration --> <!-- --> <!-- ===================================================================== -->
<server>
<classpath codebase="lib" archives="dcm4che.jar,prnscp.jar"/>
<!-- Name property calledAET defines the DICOM Called AET to which this Print Service is bound. If multiple Print Services are configured - associated with different Printers or specifing different configuration settings for the same Printer - they have to be distinguished by different calledAET values. --> <mbean code="com.tiani.prnscp.print.PrinterService" name="dcm4chex:service=Printer,calledAET=TIANI_PRINT"> ...
section.para: Following additional attributes are defined by its configuration file server/default/deploy/printer-service.xml

row.entry: Specifies name of the printer used by the system. Must be one of the print names listed by utility list-printers.jar.
Specifies Manufacturer of the printer, returned in attribute Manufacturer (0008,0070) of the Printer Information Object by the N-GET Service of the DICOM Printer SOP Class.
Specifies Manufacturer's model number of the printer, returned in attribute Manufacturer Model Name (0008,1090) of the Printer Information Object by the N-GET Service of the DICOM Printer SOP Class.
Specifies Manufacturer's serial number of the printer, returned in attribute Device Serial Number (0018,1000) of the Printer Information Object by the N-GET Service of the DICOM Printer SOP Class.

Specifies Manufacturer's designation of software version of the printer, returned in attribute Software Versions (0018,1020) of the Printer Information Object by the N-GET Service of the DICOM Printer SOP Class.
Specifies maximal number of jobs in printer job queue. Printer Jobs will be locally buffered, as long the current number of jobs queued by the printer exceeds this.

Specifies, whether the state of the IPP attribute ACCEPTING_JOBS queried from the printer shall be ignored. Necessary with current J2SDK 1.4.1 for Linux, because there the returned attribute value is always NOT_ACCEPTING_JOBS, even the printer is actually ready to accept jobs.

Specifies whether the Basic Grayscale Print Management Meta SOP Class shall be provided. There is no reason to deactivate grayscale printing - except for debugging: to evaluate the behavior of Print Clients in the (unusual) case that a DICOM print server rejects the use of the Basic Grayscale Print Management Meta SOP Class. At least SupportsGrayscale or SupportsColor must be set to true - otherwise no printing at all is possible.

Specifies whether the Basic Color Print Management Meta SOP Class shall be provided. Usually, you will set it to false, if the connected printer does not support color printing. At least SupportsGrayscale or SupportsColor must be set to true - otherwise no printing at all is possible.
Specifies whether the Presentation LUT SOP Class shall be provided.
Specifies whether the Presentation Basic Annotation Box SOP Class shall be provided.

Specifies whether color mode of the (color) printer shall be also used for printing of monochrome (=grayscale) images. Some printers achieve a better dynamic range - particularly a higher optical density for black - in color mode, than in monochrome mode. But usually, gray scale images printed in color mode shows some color shades. It also depends on the preferences of the user, whether the visible quality of grayscale image print outs can be improved by printing in color mode.

Specifies whether PLUTs shall be also applied on RGB values of color images:< 0
no P-LUT will be applied= 0
P-LUT will be only applied to pure gray values (R=G=B)> 0
P-LUT will be applied for pixels with max(|R-G|,|G-B|,|B-R|) <= ApplyPLUTonRGB

Specifies whether Min Density values provided by Print Clients shall be ignored, assuming Min Density = 0 instead. Workaround for Print Clients, which cannot be configured, to send a zero - or none value at all - for Min Density. Using Min Density > 0 for paper print is rarely reasonable, but only a waste of the dynamic range of the print-out, which is already quite limited in the case of paper print, compared to film printers.
Defines Maximal Number of Copies accepted by the Print SCP.
Medium Type identifiers supported by the printer for the Basic Film Session. Multiple values can be specified, must be separated by '\' characters. The first specified value is used as the default.
Defines default Session Label that is used when the Print SCU does not specify a Session Label. $CALLING_AET$, $DATE$, $TIME$ will be replaced by current values.
Specifies all STANDARD\C,R image display formats accepted by the Print SCP for portrait orientation. Landscape image display formats are derived automatically.

entry.para: Film Size ID identifiers supported by the printer for the Basic Film Box. Multiple values can be specified, must be separated by '\' characters or line breaks. Format: id:WidthxHeight, with width and height in mm. The first specified value is used as the default Film Size.

If a Print Composer cannot be configured to send the proper Film Size ID for the Page Format, supported by the Printer (e.g. "A3"), the ID which is provided by the Print SCU (e.g. "14INx17IN) can be mapped to the dimension of the paper size available at the Printer (e.g. "14INx17IN:297x420").

row.entry: Defines the page margin for portrait orientation. Format: left,right,top,bottom margin in mm. Page margins for landscape orientation are derived automatically (s. attribute ReverseLandscape)
Defines the minimal spacing between images on the page in mm.
Defines the default film orientation that is used when the Print SCU does not specify film orientation.

Defines the direction of printing in landscape orientation. Page margin for landscape format derived from the specification for portrait orientatiion depends on it. If true, the left side of the page in landscape orientation correspondes to the top side in portrait orientation.

Magnification Type identifiers supported by the printer for the Basic Film Box or Basic Grayscale Image Box. Multiple values can be specified, must be separated by '\' characters. The first specified value is used as the default.
Defines the default Decimate/Crop Behavior that is used when the Print SCU does not specify a Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior.
Defines, if Nearest Neighbor Interpolation is used for down-scaling, instead using same interpolation types as specified for magnification. Usually, you need not change the default value: true.
Activates down-scaling to minimize printer job size. Usually, you need not change the default value: true.

Defines the maximal scaling chunk size in MB. The smaller, the larger the number of chunks, an image has to be devided for scaling. Influences necessary memory requirements (-Xmx value). Usually, you need not change the default value 10.
Defines the default Border Density identifier that is used when the Print SCU does not specify Border Density.
Defines the default Trim behavior that is used when the Print SCU does not specify Trim.

Requested Resolution ID identifiers supported by the printer for the Basic Film Box. Multiple values can be specified, must be separated by '\' characters. The first specified value is used as the default.
Defines the default Illumination that is used when the Print SCU does not specify an Illumination value for applying the presentation LUT.

Defines the default Reflected Ambient Light that is used when the Print SCU does not specify a Reflected Ambient Light value for applying the presentation LUT. For reflective media likr Paper, it has to be 0 by definition! So it is not resonable to change the default value!

entry.para: Defines the default directory, which contains Presentation LUTs as DICOM files, which can be selected by a Print SCU via the value of the Film Box attribute (2010,0150) Configuration Information: shape=<LUT-name>.
Only effective, if the Print SCU does not provide a P-LUT itself using the P-LUT SOP class.
Relative path names are resolved using jboss server directory as base directory.
Usually, you need not change the default value: conf/lut.

Associates Calling AETs with Configuration Information values. Only effective, if the calling Print SCU does whether provide a P-LUT using the PLUT SOP class, nor specifies itselfs a value of Film Box attribute (2010,0150) Configuration Information. (see )
Multiple entires must be separated by '\' characters or line breaks.
Format: <calling-aet>[.grayscale|.color]:<Configuration Information Value> (see. )
The optional [.grayscale|.color] suffix allows to associate different Configuration Information values for Grayscale and Color Print to a Calling AET.
If no entry match the calling AET, the Configuration Information specified by

para.replaceable: <Default Configuration Information Value for Grayscale Print>
<Default Configuration Information Value for Color Print>

entry.para: will be used. These two entries must be configured!
Specifies directory with contains configuration files for supported annotation display formats. Relative path names are resolved using jboss server directory as base directory.
Usually, you need not change the default value: conf/annotation.
Associates Calling AETs with Annotation Display Format available in the directory specified by attribute AnnotationDir.
Only effective, if the calling Print SCU does not specify an annotation display format.

Multiple entires must be separated by '\' characters or line breaks. If no entry match the calling AET, the Presentation LUT specified in the first entry will be used. At least, one entry must be configured!
Format: <calling-aet>:<annotation ID>
Specifies name of annotation display format used for the print image printout.
Usually, you need not change the default value: NO_TITLE

row.entry: Defines Date Format used in Annotations.
Defines Time Format used in Annotations.

entry.para: Specifies directory, containing calibration related configuration files:

listitem.para: measured (256) OD values of reference DSI256 pattern
OD values in monochrome mode. Measured from mochrome print-out of DSI16 or DSI256 pattern or calculated from most recent <calledAET>.monochrome/*.jpg
OD values in color mode. Measured from color print-out of DSI16 or DSI256 pattern or calculated from most recent <calledAET>.color/*.jpg
scanned reference DSI256 pattern
scanned DSI256 pattern printed in monochrome mode
scanned DSI256 pattern printed in color mode

entry.para: Relative path names are resolved using jboss server directory as base directory.
Usually, you need not change the default value: conf/calibration..
See .
Specifies threshold in device driving levels, used for Border Detection by printer OD calculation from scanned DSI256 pattern print-out.
Usually, you need not change the default value 200.
Specifies extension of measurement area in % of the box dimension, used by printer OD calculation from scanned DSI256 pattern print-out.
Usually, you need not change the default value 50.

Specifies if printer ODs calculated from scanned DSI256 pattern printout shall be adjusted to min OD = 0, to decrease derivation from actual ODs caused by limited gray resolution of scanned printout..
Usually, you need not change the default value true.
Specifies tolerable loss (in %) of print dynamic (max OD) to avoid use of DDL values in non monotonic parts of the printer characteristic curve.
Usually, you need not change the default value 5.
Specifies if measured/calculated ODs of printer characteristic shall be smoothed to avoid quantisation effect caused by limited resolution of OD measurements/scan pixel values.
Usually, you need not change the default value true.
Activates redirection of all printing into a postscript file, specified by attribute PrintToFilePath.
Only used for debugging.

row.entry: Specifies path of the postscript file, to which all printing is redirected, if attribute PrintToFile is true.

section.title: Dependencies between jPrint Services
section.para: At default configuration, there is only one instance of each jPrint Service type configured. There may be use cases (e.g.: to connect two different printers) where several instances of one jPrint Service type (e.g. the Printer Service) have to be configured. In that case, a modified copy of the configuration file for the primary service instance (e.g. printer-service.xml) have to be store into the same directory as <anyName>-service.xml. In general, the literal name of a service configuration file does not matter, as long it ends with -service.xml.
shows the dependencies between jPrint Services.

DICOM Server, Print SCP and Print Service make use of the same Audit Logger Service. Every Printer Service is connected to one Print SCP Service which is itself registered to one Dicom Server instance. But there may be more than one Printer Service connected to the same Print SCP instance.

If several DICOM server instances shall be running - e.g. one in secure (DICOM-TLS) mode, and another without TLS - not only the configuration file for the DICOM server dcmsrv-service.xml have to be cloned and modified for each additional DICOM server that shall run, but also new instances of the Print SCP and the Printer Service have to be configured by additional copies of prnscp-service.xml and printer-service.xml. Because one Print SCP services cannot be registered in several DICOM servers, as one Printer Service cannot be connected to several different Print SCP services!
The relationship between different service instances is defined by <depends> elements in the configuration files. E.g. in printer-service.xml:

the first <depends> element connect this Printer Service to the Print SCP service with the MBean name dcm4chex:service=PrintSCP, and the second name the Audit Logger Service dcm4chex:service=AuditLogger,name=AUDITLOG which will be used.
Or in printscp-service.xml:

the first <depends> element register this Print SCP Service to the DICOM server with the MBean name dcm4chex:service=DcmServer,name=DCMSRV, the second define the dependency to the used Audit Logger Service as in printer-service.xml.

Every service have to have a different MBean name. Hence, when several instances of the same service type are configured, the MBean name specified in its configuration file have to be different. E.g., if you running two DICOM server, you have to change the MBean name of the second instance in its configuration file from the default value dcm4chex:service=DcmServer,name=DCMSRV to - for example - dcm4chex:service=DcmServer,name=DCMSRV2.

section.title: Local Lookup Tables
section.para: jPrint supports the configuration of local lookup tables at the Print Server. This feature is intended as workaround for Print Composers, which does not provide proper P-LUTs via the N-CREATE Service of the DICOM Presentation Lookup Table SOP Class. The use of local LUTs needs/shall only be configured for Print Composers with no - or inappropriate - support of the DICOM P-LUT SOP Class.
A local LUT can be defined by an explicit DICOM file with a Presentation LUT Information Object or by 1-3 parameters of a proprietary generation function for S-shaped P-LUTs.
A Print SCU can select such (jPrint) local LUT by providing a value for Film Box attribute (2010,0150) Configuration Information:

row.entry: interprets pixel values as linear optical density over the range of Min Density (2010,0120) and Max Density (2010,1030).
P-LUT Information Object in file <LUT-name>.lut in directory server/default/conf/lut.

entry.literallayout: applies a LUT based on f(x) ~ x^(1/g): g > 1 will increase the contrast in the dark and lighten the image as a whole, g < 1 will increase the contrast of brighten parts and darken then image as a whole.

row.entry: applies a S-shaped P-LUT, which enhanced the contrast around a defined center (c = 0.5 specifies middle of pixel value range), with the factor specified by slope (e.g.: s=2 doubles the contrast).
applies a P-LUT generated as combination of the S-shaped function defined by center=<c>,slope=<s> and the power function defined by gamma=<g>.

section.para: This values can also be used in the Printer Service configuration server/default/deploy/printer-service.xml, to associate a LUT to the Calling AET of a Print SCU (s. Printer Service attribute ConfigurationInformationForCallingAET), in the (common) case, that the Print SCU cannot be configured, to provide a Configuration Information value as described above.

Utility view-plut.jar can be used to display the shape of P-LUTs specified by center=<c>,slope=<s>,gamma=<g>. It also supports to apply such P-LUT on a DICOM image and show its effect on the resulting image.
Utility print-image.jar can be used to print out a local DICOM image with a P-LUT specified by a Configuration Information value directly - without the need of a DICOM Print Client.

section.title: Annotation Display Formats
section.para: jPrint provides DICOM Services of the Basic Annotation Box SOP Class, which allows a Print SCU to select one of preconfigured Annotaion Display Formats based on the value of the Attribute Annotation Display Format ID (2010,0030) of the Basic Film Box and to set the values of its editable text fields (=Annotation Boxes).

If a Print Composer does not support the Basic Annotation Box SOP Class, the selection of the Annotation Display Format can be configured based on its Calling AET (s. Printer Service configuration attribute AnnotationForCallingAET).

section.title: ADF Configuration Files
section.para: Annotation Display Formats are specified by text files located in directory server/default/conf/annotations. The file names are constrained to the format:

listitem.para: ID used as value of Attribute Annotation Display Format ID (2010,0030) of the Basic Film Box and in Printer Service configuration attribute AnnotationForCallingAET to reference this format.
Number of text fields (=Annotation Boxes) defined by this format.

section.para: The text files contains a list properties (key and element pairs). Every property occupies one line. Each line is terminated by a line terminator (line feed or carriage return + line feed).
A line that contains only whitespace or whose first non-whitespace character is an ASCII # or ! is ignored (thus, # or ! indicate comment lines).

The key consists of all the characters in the line starting with the first non-whitespace character and up to, but not including, the first ASCII =, :, or whitespace character. All remaining characters on the line become part of the associated value string. Within the value string, the ASCII escape sequences \t, \n, \r, \\, \", \' and \ (a backslash and a space) are recognized and converted to single characters.
The default configuration contains the definition for two Annotation Display Formats:

listitem.para: Specifies Annotation Display Format TITLE: 5 Annotation Boxes located on the four edges and one - with larger font size - centered at the top of the page. Used for all DICOM prints with default server/default/deploy/printer-service.xml. Usually you will at least edit the specified Default Title.

Specifies Annotation Display Format NO_TITLE: Like Annotation Display Format TITLE, but without a centered Annotation Box at the top of the page. Used for print-outs initiated with utility print-image.jar at default configuration.

section.title: ADF Properties
section.para: Usually, annotations are printed near the page margin, surrounding the printed image(s). You can specify an inset of the aera, which shall be used for the image(s) to print, from the actual printable area on the page (s. Print Service Attribute PageMargin). E.g. server/default/conf/annotation/TITLE.5.adf

defines a (minmal) margin of 20 points (1 point = 1/72 inch) above and below the printed image inside the printable aera, to accommodate the annotations. The actual distance between the border of the printed image and the page margin may be larger than defined by inset.* properties: Because the aspect ratio of the image has to be preserved, only the full width OR the full height of the aera reserved for the image(s) may be used.

The properties with 1,2,... <N> as key, specifies the default content of the first, second, .. N-th text field (=Annotation Box) of the defined Annotation Display Format. Properties with a key name prefixed by a text field number only concern that text field. E.g. server/default/conf/annotation/TITLE.5.adf

defines Default Title as default content of the first text field, which shall be printed with a font size of 16 points, horizontial centered with the bottom line of the text 2 points above the top of the aera reserved for the printed image(s).
Non-prefixed key names define global properties, which may be overwritten by corresponding text field specific properties. E.g. server/default/conf/annotation/TITLE.5.adf

defines Serif 8 plain style, color black as default font. In the example above, the size of the font used for the first annotation box was overwritten to be 16 points, so Default Title will be printed in Serif 16 plain style, color black.

row.entry: The inset of the aera in points (1/72 inch), which shall be used for the image(s) to print, from the actual printable area on the page.
Name, point size, style and color of the font used to print the annotation text. Used as global properties or as specific for a individual Annotation Box.
black, blue, cyan, gray, green, magenta, orange, pink, red, white, yellow

Defines horizontal location of <i>.Annotation Box on the page. The optional offset <off> specifies the distance from the left or right image area border in points. A postive value corresponds a shift to right.

Defines vertical location of <i>.Annotation Box on the page. The optional offset <off> specifies the distance from the top or bottom image area border in points. A postive value corresponds a shift down.
Defines horizontal alignment of the text relatively to its horizontal location.
Defines vertical alignment of the text relatively to its vertical location.

section.title: Keyword substitution
section.para: The default text for the annotation box may embed strings of the form $KEYWORD$ which are replaced by its corresponding value, just before the Print Job for this page is transmitted to the connected printer:

listitem.para: The value of Attribute Film Session Label (2000,0050) of the Basic Film Session provided by the Print Composer or the Print Service Configuration Attribute SessionLabel.
The calling Application Entity Title of the Print Composer.
The called Application Entity Title associated with the used Printer Service.
The current date in the format defined by Print Service Configuration Attribute DateFormat.
The current time in the format defined by Print Service Configuration Attribute TimeFormat.

The number of the current page in a DICOM Print Job initated for a Film Session which contains several Film Boxes. - But usually, Print Composers initiate a Print Job for every Film Box (=page) individually. Then the page number is not available by jPrint and $PAGE$ will be replaced by 1!

The total number of pages printed in a DICOM Print Job initated for a Film Session which contains several Film Boxes. - But usually, Print Composers initiate a Print Job for every Film Box (=page) individually. Then the total number of pages is not available by jPrint and $PAGE$ will be replaced by 1!
The name of the license owner, encoded in the license file server/default/conf/license.jks. If no license file was found by jPrint at start up, $LICENSE_CN$ will be replaced by nobody.

The expire date of the license server/default/conf/license.jks in the format defined by Print Service Configuration Attribute DateFormat. If no license file was found by jPrint at start up, $LICENSE_ENDDATE$ will be replaced by the current date.

section.para: E.g. server/default/conf/annotation/TITLE.5.adf

defines the (default) content of the third Annotation Box at the upper right corner of the page as two lines - \n causes the line break - with the first including the Called AET associated with the used Printer Service, and the second the current date and time.

section.title: Printer Calibration
section.para: To achieve hard copy presentation quality and consistency compliant to DICOM Part 14: Grayscale Standard Display Function, jPrint has to quantify the characteristic curve of the connected printers. This procedure is called Printer Calibration, and shall be repeated in regular intervalls, but particular after any printer adjustment (e.g. toner refill).

section.title: The Test Patterns
section.para: The jPrint destribution package contains several test pattern - as DICOM images - which are used to determine the printer characteristics and to evaluate the print quality after the calibration:

row.entry: images/DSI16.dcm -Philips dsitest image with 16 boxes with shades of gray from black to white, with equidistant pixel values. Used for manual measurement of printer characteristics and for quatitative verification of proper Printer Calibration.

images/DSI256.dcm - Derived from the DSI16 pattern, by splitting each of the 16 boxes again in 16 different shades - so it contains 256 gray shades with equidistant pixel values. Used for calculating the printer characteristic curve by jPrint from the scan from an up-to-date print-out of this image and of a scan of a reference sheet with the pattern with known OD values.
images/WEDGE8.dcm - 8-bit Wedge pattern contains a transition from black to white in 45 degree angled lines with 256 different shades of gray. Used for qualitative verification of the print quality.

images/WETestDGE12.dcm - 12-bit Wedge pattern contains four stripes with a transition from black to white in 45 degree angled lines with 4096 different shades of gray for qualitative verification of the print quality.

images/ASPECT.dcm - The Pixel Aspect Ratio pattern shows a transition from black to white. The source image contains a pixel aspect ratio of 4:1 (512 by 128 pixels). Correctly printed, the image has a square shape.

section.para: Test patterns can be printed by using the utility print-image.jar.

section.title: Collecting Printer Characteristics
section.para: There are two options to determine the characteristic curve of the connected printer(s):

listitem.para: Manually measuring of the optical density (OD) values releated to different driver device levels (DDLs) on the print-out of the DSI256 or DSI16 pattern, using an optical densitometer.

Scanning a print-out of the DSI256 pattern and a reference sheet with the same pattern by a digital scanner and store the scans as JPG files into the jprint calibration subdirectories, so jPrint can calculate the OD values on the print-out by comparison of both scans.

section.para: For color printers, two charactertic curves have to be determined: one for monochrome and one for color mode.

section.title: OD Measurement with Densitometer
section.para: You can decide beween measurement of only 16 OD values related to equidistant DDLs - then jPrint will estimate the OD values for intermediate DDLs by interpolation -, or you can take the effort and measure the OD values of all 256 different DDLs manually.
Dependend on your decision, you have to print out the images/DSI16.dcm or the images/DSI256.dcm pattern, using the utility print-image.jar:
section.programlisting: $ cd jprint-1.2.1/bin $ java -jar print-image.jar -a <AET> ../images/DSI16.dcm or $ java -jar print-image.jar -a <AET> ../images/DSI256.dcm
section.para: with <AET> as the configured AET associated with this printer (default: TIANI_PRINT).
Start the measurement with the white box at the left bottom corner and set the zero point of the densitometer to this measurement. Continue the measurements with increasing OD values.
Following figure shows the order of the measurements for the 16 OD values on the DSI16 pattern.

figure.title: Order of the OD measurements in DSI16 pattern

section.para: In the case of the DSI256 pattern, each of the 16 boxes is itself divided into 4x4 boxes, which ODs have to be measured individually in the same meander-like order, as the boxes of the main pattern.
Enter the measurements in a text file - one OD value per line - and store it as <AET>.monochrome.ods in the server/default/conf/calibration/ subdirectory of the jPrint installation.
For color printers, you have also to print the test pattern in color mode:
and store the measurements of this print-out as text file <AET>.color.ods in the server/default/conf/calibration/ subdirectory of the jPrint installation.

section.title: OD Calculation from Scans
section.para: jPrint supports the use of a common A4 flat bet scanner to determine the ODs of the print-out of the images/DSI256.dcm pattern with defined DDLs.
To determine the charactertic curve of the scanner, you need a reference paper sheet with the images/DSI256.dcm pattern with known ODs.

You will receive a reference page corresponding to the OD values defined in server/default/conf/calibration/DSI256.ods of the default configuration by paper post, after ordering a (evaluation) license of jPrint at http://www.tiani.com/products/jprint/.

If a densitometer is available, you may also create your own reference sheet, by measuring the 256 OD values of a print out of images/DSI256.dcm and store them in server/default/conf/calibration/DSI256.ods (s. ).

Scan this DSI256 reference sheet - if landscape or portrait orientation does not matter - and store it as JPEG file server/default/conf/calibration/DSI256.jpg. A scan resolution of ~300dpi is sufficient.
Print out the images/DSI256.dcm pattern, using the utility print-image.jar:
with <AET> as the configured Application Entity Title associated with this printer (default: TIANI_PRINT).

Scan the images/DSI256.dcm print-out - with equal scanner parameters as you scanned the reference sheet before - and store it as JPEG file server/default/conf/calibration/<AET>.monochrome/<anyFilename>.jpg.
For color printers, you have also to print images/DSI256.dcm in color mode:
and scan that print-out and store it as JPEG file server/default/conf/calibration/<AET>.color/<anyFilename>.jpg.

jPrint calculates the charactertic curve from the scans, when it performs the next print out. The analysing of the scans can take some time - depended on the used scan resolution. You may see the corresponding messages in the console log:
section.programlisting: 21:27:14,330 INFO [PrinterService] Calibrating Printer TIANI_PRINT, chromaticity=monochrome 21:28:30,725 INFO [PrinterService] Printer OD range [monochrome]: total=0.0-1.62, used=0.0-1.62, DDL=255-6 21:28:30,745 INFO [PrinterService] Calibrated Printer TIANI_PRINT, chromaticity=monochrome
section.para: jPrint stores the calculated charactertic curve in server/default/conf/calibration/<AET>.monochrome.ods - or for color mode print: server/default/conf/calibration/<AET>.color.ods - so the calculation has only be performed one time.
This calculation can be triggered by using the utility print-image.jar:

to print a test pattern. The option -i shape=IDENTITY forces jPrint to print the image calibrated according the Grayscale Standard Display Function (GSDF). Without that, the pixel values are directly used as DDL, so jPrint would not need to know the printer charactertics to perform the print and no calculation of the charactertic curve would be triggered.

jPrint always use the most recent scan file in directory server/default/conf/calibration/<AET>.monochrome/ - for prints in color mode: server/default/conf/calibration/<AET>.color/ - for the calculating of the printer charateristics. So you only need to drop scans of current print-outs of images/DSI256.dcm into this directories, to keep the Printer Calibration up-to-date with the - possible changing - printer characterstics.

You may evaluate the printer charateristics from the stored scans by utility view-printerODs.jar. This is in particular useful, if you are experimenting with different printer configurations, to evaluate the effect on the charateristic curve(s), or to evaluate the drift of the printer characterstics over time.

section.title: Testing the Visual Image Quality
section.para: Initiate the calibrated print-out of the WEDGE8 pattern by:

with <AET> as the configured Application Entity Title associated with this printer (default: TIANI_PRINT). The option -i shape=IDENTITY causes jPrint to print the image calibrated according the Grayscale Standard Display Function (GSDF).
The hardcopy should not contain visible contours - the transition from dark to bright within the wedge should be smooth.
You may also compare the result against the print-out of the same pattern without calibration by
For color printers, repeat the check for a calibrated print-out of the WEDGE8 pattern in color mode:

section.title: Quantitative Verification of the Printer Calibration to GSDF
section.para: If a densitometer is available, you can determine the derivation of the Printer Calibration to the DICOM Grayscale Standard Display Function (GSDF), using a Microsoft Excel or OpenOffice.org spreadsheed included in the jPrint distribution:
Initiate the calibrated print-out of the DSI16 pattern by:

with <AET> as the configured Application Entity Title associated with this printer (default: TIANI_PRINT). The option -i shape=IDENTITY causes jPrint to print the image calibrated according the Grayscale Standard Display Function (GSDF).

Open the Hardcopy Calibration Form doc/gsdf_od.xls (Microsoft Excel) or doc/gsdf_od.sxc (OpenOffice.org Spreadsheet). It contains two tables: the first table is used to enter the measured optical density (OD) values and some administrative data, the second one is automatically filled.

Enter as value of Illumination the same as configured in server/default/deploy/printer-service.xml, default: 150. For reflective media - and so for Paper Printer - the value for Reflected Light must be set to 0.

Start the measurement with the white box at the left bottom corner and set the zero point of the densitometer to this measurement. Continue with the measurements with increasing OD values in the order shown in the following figure:

figure.title: Order of the OD measurements in DSI16 pattern

section.para: and enter the values in the spreadsheet fields measured Box #1 - measured Box #16.
Change to the Output table and evaluate the result. The maximal relative derivation of any measurement from the calculated GSDF value should not extend 10%.

section.title: print-image.jar
section.programlisting:
$ java -jar print-image.jar -h
Usage: java -jar print-image.jar [OPTIONS] FILE
Print DICOM image in FILE
Options: -a, --aet=AET print on printer bound to specified AET. Default: TIANI_PRINT -i, --info=CFG print image with specified Configuration Information -c, --color print image in color print mode (default grayscale) -h, --help show this help and exit
